LanguageData.Craftsmanship_SettingsDescription: Pawns who share a passion may chat and train one another. These settings allow you to customize the frequency and benefit of those interactions.
LanguageData.Craftsmanship_ChanceSettingTooltip: Determines how likely pawns are to engage in skill-based passion chats. 0% = Never happens. 100% = Always happens when conditions are met.
LanguageData.Craftsmanship_XPMultiplierTooltip: Adjusts how much experience the student gains from a passion chat. 1.0x is the default value. Increase this to make skill sharing more impactful.
LanguageData.Craftsmanship_RequirePassionTooltip: When checked, pawns must both be passionate about the skill to chat about it. If unchecked, any skill discussion is allowed.
LanguageData.Craftsmanship_SocialBuffLabel: Give social opinion buff after chatting?
LanguageData.Craftsmanship_SocialBuffTooltip: When enabled, pawns gain a positive opinion after chatting about shared/passionate skills, improving their relationship.
